verses.roman:
ebe sabā-sthāne muñi māgoṅ eka dāne
sabe meli' ājñā deha, yāiba dakṣiṇe

synonyms: ebe—now; sabā-sthāne—from all of you; muñi—I; māgoṅ—beg; eka dāne—one gift; sabe meli'-all combining together; ājñā deha—give permission; yāiba—I shall go; dakṣiṇe—to South India.
translation: "I now beg all of you for one bit of charity. Please give Me permission to leave for a tour of South India.
